history.content:
The universal application for any teaching role in EECS classes:

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/gsis/prospective/applications

The priority deadline has passed but you should still try applying. I think tutoring is where you have people come to you with questions during an "office hour", whereas TA leads a discussion section. I also hear that a natural path to becoming a TA is by first lab assisting and then tutoring. 

____________________

TA's are have discussions, labs, and help in office hours. Tutors have smaller (4-5 people) sections and help in office hours

The universal application for any teaching role in EECS classes:

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/gsis/prospective/applications

The priority deadline has passed but you should still try applying. I think tutoring is where you have people come to you with questions during an "office hour", whereas TA leads a discussion section. I also hear that a natural path to becoming a TA is by first lab assisting and then tutoring.

children.subject: Tutors will be hired via CSM (if the process follows from the past 2 semesters) but still mark it on the application. TAs will be hired directly by the instructor/head TAs.

history.content: Does anyone know where I can find the application to be a tutor / TA for CS61A next semester? Also, what's the difference between the two? I was a lab assistant over the summer for CS61A, but wanted to have more responsibilities than a lab assistant.
history.subject: Tutor / TA for CS61A
